briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of BAY1192631 in Japanese Patients With Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA) Infections
officialTitle: A Prospective, Randomized, Open-label, Active-controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of BAY 1192631 in Japanese Patients With MRSA Infections (Skin and Soft Tissue Infection [SSTI] and SSTI-related Bacteremia)
summary: The aim of this study is to see the efficacy and safety of BAY1192631 in Japanese patients with methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (skin and soft tissue infections (SSTI) and SSTI-related bacteremia).

primaryOutcome.measure: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 7-14 days after the end of treatment (EOT) for skin and soft tissue infections (SSTI) and 4-6 weeks after EOT for bacteremia
